revised_title: Evolutionary Significance of Satellite DNA and Heterochromatin in Newts
tldr: The authors analyze the patterns of variation in satellite DNA and heterochromatin in newts of the genus Triturus, examining their functional and evolutionary significance. They propose a model linking evolutionary changes in satellite DNAs and chromosome structure, and discuss the potential impact of satellite DNA on cell proliferation and organismal growth. The study suggests that satellite DNA may have an adaptive role in the development and evolution of newts.
